result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony F Tarantino was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Total costs due during term of supervision. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to participate in drug and/or alcohol counseling and treatment deemed appropriate by DOC and to pay all costs of treatment.
Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant to submit DNA sample within 30 days.
Pay supervision fees.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony F Tarantino in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty.   Court gives voting restriction and firearm warning to defendant orally in court. Court renders sentence.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony F Tarantino in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter was scheduled for dispo today, however, counsel requests matter be adjourned due to amended complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jamie McClendon requests hearing on October 10 be removed from the calendar and a change of plea/sentencing date be scheduled. No objection by State. Matter scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 10:00 am. Date and time confirmed with parties.
Further proceedings on October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony F Tarantino in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel requests matter be adjourned as she just received information for count 2. Counsel enters not guilty plea on count 2.  Further proceedings scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Anthony F Tarantino in court with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel submits waiver of preliminary hearing.  Court examines the defendant as to the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver, finding it to be free and voluntary.  State files Information.  Counsel acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives its reading, and enters a Not Guilty plea to all counts.  Further proceedings scheduled for August 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status hearing on June 16, 2016 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Anthony F Tarantino appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant in custody. Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel waives reading.  Court finds probable cause based on the complaint.  State requesting $500 signature bond w/conditions.  Counsel advises the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation.  Court examines defendant on right to counsel.  Court finds good cause to extend timelimits.  Status hearing scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:15 am.
